surface_layer.definition: A subfield of ergonomics that deals with mental processes, such as perception, memory, and reasoning, as they affect interactions among humans and other elements of a system.
common_uses: Designing user interfaces that are easy to understand and use
Improving training programs to enhance learning effectiveness

deep_layer.mechanism: Applies principles of cognitive psychology to design systems that minimize mental workload and maximize performance.
deep_layer.origin: Evolved from cognitive psychology and human factors research.

examples: Designing a control panel with clear and intuitive labels
Creating a training simulation that accurately reflects real-world scenarios

citations: Natural Human-Computer Interfaces' Paradigm and Cognitive Ergonomics
